title: PM's Ethics Adviser Quits Over 'Odious Position'
itunes:title: PM's Ethics Adviser Quits Over 'Odious Position'
description:
Boris Johnson's ethics adviser Christopher Geidt has quit his position, saying the Prime Minister put him in an 'impossible and odious position' by considering a deliberate breach of the ministerial code. Bloomberg's Caroline Hepker and Stephen Carroll discuss the context for with Opinion Columnist Therese Raphael. Plus: Business Minister Martin Callanan speaks to us about implementing the UK's national security and investment law, and Mel Stride, chair of the Treasury Committee, discusses his warning against ripping up financial regulations.
